<script>
import axios from 'axios';
import { apiUrl } from '@/constants';
import { translateField } from '@/utils/formFields-translator';

// Import search input components
import DisciplineInput from '@/components/ui-components/search/search-inputs/discipline-input.vue';
import SportInput from '@/components/ui-components/search/search-inputs/sport-input.vue';
import GenderInput from '@/components/ui-components/search/search-inputs/gender-input.vue';
import AthleteCategoryInput from '@/components/ui-components/search/search-inputs/athlete-category-input.vue';
import JuryCategoryInput from '@/components/ui-components/search/search-inputs/jury-category-input.vue';
import SeasonInput from '@/components/ui-components/search/search-inputs/season-input.vue';

// Import MDI icons
import { 
  mdiMagnify, 
  mdiClose, 
  mdiTune, 
  mdiChevronUp, 
  mdiChevronDown, 
  mdiLightningBolt 
} from '@mdi/js';

export default {
  name: 'search-mobile',
  
  components: {
    SeasonInput,
    JuryCategoryInput,
    AthleteCategoryInput,
    GenderInput,
    SportInput,
    DisciplineInput,
  },

  props: {
    mode: {
      type: String,
      required: true,
      validator: (value) => ['events', 'athletes', 'jury', 'trainers', 'organizations', 'seminars'].includes(value)
    }
  },

  data() {
    return {
      // UI State
      showSearchModal: false,
      showAdvancedFilters: false,
      isSearching: false,
      quickSearchValue: '',
      
      // Icons
      icons: {
        mdiMagnify,
        mdiClose,
        mdiTune,
        mdiChevronUp,
        mdiChevronDown,
        mdiLightningBolt
      },

      // Search Data (mirrors desktop component)
      searchFilters: {
        events: {
          title: '',
          discipline: '',
          season: '',
          date: '',
          location: '',
          calendar_code: '',
        },
        athletes: {
          ffr_id: '',
          discipline: '',
          name: '',
          gender: '',
          year: '',
          category: '',
          region: '',
        },
        jury: {
          jury_code: '',
          name: '',
          discipline: '',
          gender: '',
          age: '',
          jury_category: '',
          region: '',
        },
        trainers: {
          trainer_id: '',
          fullname: '',
          discipline: '',
          gender: '',
          region: '',
        },
        organizations: {
          title: '',
          region: '',
        },
        seminars: {
          discipline: '',
          season: '',
          region: '',
          location: '',
          date: '',
        },
      },

      // Search Configuration
      searchConfig: {
        events: { quickField: 'title', title: 'События', placeholder: 'Название события...' },
        athletes: { quickField: 'name', title: 'Спортсмены', placeholder: 'Имя спортсмена...' },
        jury: { quickField: 'name', title: 'Судьи', placeholder: 'Имя судьи...' },
        trainers: { quickField: 'fullname', title: 'Тренеры', placeholder: 'Имя тренера...' },
        organizations: { quickField: 'title', title: 'Организации', placeholder: 'Название организации...' },
        seminars: { quickField: 'location', title: 'Семинары', placeholder: 'Место проведения...' },
      }
    };
  },

  computed: {
    getSearchFields() {
      return this.searchFilters[this.mode] || {};
    },

    getSearchTitle() {
      return `Поиск: ${this.searchConfig[this.mode]?.title || 'Элементы'}`;
    },

    getQuickSearchPlaceholder() {
      return this.searchConfig[this.mode]?.placeholder || 'Введите поисковый запрос...';
    },

    activeFilters() {
      const filters = [];
      
      // Add quick search to active filters
      if (this.quickSearchValue) {
        const quickField = this.searchConfig[this.mode]?.quickField;
        filters.push({
          key: 'quick_search',
          label: this.translateField(quickField),
          value: this.quickSearchValue
        });
      }

      // Add advanced filters
      Object.entries(this.getSearchFields).forEach(([key, value]) => {
        if (value && value.toString().trim()) {
          filters.push({
            key,
            label: this.translateField(key),
            value: value.toString()
          });
        }
      });

      return filters;
    },

    getResultsCountText() {
      return this.activeFilters.length > 0 
        ? `(${this.activeFilters.length} фильтр${this.activeFilters.length > 1 ? 'а' : ''})`
        : '';
    }
  },

  methods: {
    translateField,

    // Modal Management
    openSearchModal() {
      this.showSearchModal = true;
      // Focus management will be handled by Vuetify
    },

    closeSearchModal() {
      this.showSearchModal = false;
    },

    // Search Operations
    async performSearch() {
      this.isSearching = true;
      this.$emit('search-loading', true);

      try {
        const searchParams = new URLSearchParams();
        
        // Add quick search parameter
        if (this.quickSearchValue) {
          const quickField = this.searchConfig[this.mode]?.quickField;
          if (quickField) {
            searchParams.append(quickField, this.quickSearchValue);
          }
        }

        // Add advanced filter parameters
        Object.entries(this.getSearchFields).forEach(([key, value]) => {
          if (value && value.toString().trim()) {
            searchParams.append(key, value);
          }
        });

        const queryString = searchParams.toString();
        const response = await axios.get(`${apiUrl}/${this.mode}/find${queryString ? '?' + queryString : ''}`);
        
        if (response.status === 200) {
          this.$emit('search-results-loaded', response.data[this.mode]);
          this.closeSearchModal();
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.error('Mobile search error:', error.response?.data?.message || error.message);
        // Emit error state
        this.$emit('search-error', error.response?.data?.message || 'Ошибка поиска');
      } finally {
        this.isSearching = false;
        this.$emit('search-loading', false);
      }
    },

    // Filter Management
    onQuickSearchInput(value) {
      // Optional: Implement debounced search-as-you-type here
      // For now, keep it simple with manual search
    },

    clearFilter(filterKey) {
      if (filterKey === 'quick_search') {
        this.quickSearchValue = '';
      } else if (this.getSearchFields[filterKey] !== undefined) {
        this.getSearchFields[filterKey] = '';
      }
    },

    clearAllFilters() {
      this.quickSearchValue = '';
      Object.keys(this.getSearchFields).forEach(key => {
        this.getSearchFields[key] = '';
      });
    },

    // Touch Optimizations
    handleTouchStart() {
      // Optional: Add touch-specific optimizations
    }
  },

  // Lifecycle
  mounted() {
    // Add any initialization logic
  },

  beforeDestroy() {
    // Cleanup if needed
  }
};
</script>

## **Frontend Agent** 🎨 **Critical Issues Found:**

### ❌ **MAJOR VIOLATIONS**

1. **Search Input Component Interface Violation**
   ```vue
   <!-- WRONG: My implementation uses props that don't exist -->
   <sport-input :label="translateField(key)" />
   
   <!-- CORRECT: Existing components only support v-model -->
   <sport-input v-model="getSearchFields[key]" />
   ```

2. **Responsive Design Inconsistency**
   ```scss
   // WRONG: Using hardcoded px values
   @media screen and (max-width: 480px) 
   
   // CORRECT: Should use CSS custom properties
   @media screen and (max-width: var(--mobile-small))
   ```

3. **Button Color Pattern Violation**
   ```vue
   <!-- WRONG: Vuetify color prop with CSS variable -->
   <v-btn color="var(--accent)" />
   
   <!-- CORRECT: Use CSS class styling -->
   <v-btn class="accent-button" />
   ```

4. **Missing Architecture Pattern**
   - Search inputs use native `<select>` elements, not Vuetify components
   - My implementation mixes Vuetify and native elements inconsistently

   - Hard-coded search configurations should be externalized
   - No separation of concerns between UI and business logic

   }

## **CORRECTED IMPLEMENTATION APPROACH**

Let me provide a **properly architected** solution that follows the existing patterns:

### **1. Modular Component Structure**

```vue:frontend/src/components/ui-components/search/search-mobile.vue
<template>
  <div class="search-mobile">
    <!-- Mobile Search Trigger -->
    <v-btn 
      fab 
      fixed 
      bottom 
      right 
      class="search-mobile__trigger accent-button"
      @click="showModal = true"
    >
      <v-icon>{{ icons.mdiMagnify }}</v-icon>
    </v-btn>

    <!-- Search Modal -->
    <v-dialog 
      v-model="showModal" 
      fullscreen 
      transition="dialog-bottom-transition"
    >
      <search-mobile-content 
        :mode="mode"
        @search="handleSearch"
        @close="showModal = false"
      />
    </v-dialog>
  </div>
</template>

<script>
import { mdiMagnify } from '@mdi/js';
import SearchMobileContent from './search-mobile-content.vue';

export default {
  name: 'search-mobile',
  components: { SearchMobileContent },
  props: ['mode'],
  data: () => ({
    showModal: false,
    icons: { mdiMagnify }
  }),
  methods: {
    async handleSearch(searchParams) {
      this.$emit('search-loading', true);
      try {
        const response = await this.$http.get(`/api/v1/${this.mode}/find`, { params: searchParams });
        this.$emit('search-results-loaded', response.data[this.mode]);
        this.showModal = false;
      } catch (error) {
        console.error('Search error:', error);
      } finally {
        this.$emit('search-loading', false);
      }
    }
  }
};
</script>

<style lang="scss" scoped>
.search-mobile {
  &__trigger {
    margin: 0 16px 80px 0 !important;
    z-index: 1001 !important;
  }
}

.accent-button {
  background-color: var(--accent) !important;
  color: white !important;
}

@media screen and (max-width: var(--mobile-small)) {
  .search-mobile__trigger {
    margin: 0 12px 70px 0 !important;
  }
}
</style>
```

### **3. Reusable Search Content Component**

```vue:frontend/src/components/ui-components/search/search-mobile-content.vue
<template>
  <v-card class="search-mobile-content">
    <search-mobile-header 
      :title="searchConfig.title"
      @close="$emit('close')"
      @clear="clearFilters"
    />
    
    <search-mobile-form
      :mode="mode"
      :search-fields="searchFields"
      @search="$emit('search', $event)"
    />
  </v-card>
</template>

<script>
import { SEARCH_FIELD_CONFIGS, SEARCH_UI_CONFIGS } from '@/utils/search-configs';

export default {
  name: 'search-mobile-content',
  props: ['mode'],
  data() {
    return {
      searchFields: { ...SEARCH_FIELD_CONFIGS[this.mode] }
    };
  },
  computed: {
    searchConfig() {
      return SEARCH_UI_CONFIGS[this.mode];
    }
  },
  methods: {
    clearFilters() {
      this.searchFields = { ...SEARCH_FIELD_CONFIGS[this.mode] };
    }
  }
};
</script>
```

### **4. Proper Input Component Usage**

```vue:frontend/src/components/ui-components/search/search-mobile-form.vue
<template>
  <form @submit.prevent="performSearch">
    <div v-for="(_, key) in searchFields" :key="key" class="search-field">
      
      <!-- Use existing components exactly as they are -->
      <sport-input 
        v-if="key === 'sport'" 
        v-model="searchFields[key]"
      />
      
      <discipline-input 
        v-else-if="key === 'discipline'" 
        v-model="searchFields[key]"
      />
      
      <!-- Native inputs for other fields (following existing pattern) -->
      <input 
        v-else 
        v-model="searchFields[key]" 
        :id="key" 
        :name="key" 
        class="searchInput__control" 
        :placeholder="translateField(key)"
      />
    </div>
    
    <v-btn type="submit" class="search-button">Поиск</v-btn>
  </form>
</template>

<style lang="scss">
@import url('../search-inputs/search-input-style.css');

.search-button {
  background-color: var(--text-contrast) !important;
  color: var(--text-default) !important;
}
</style>

<!-- Defensive Template Design -->
<template>
  <div class="search-mobile">
    <!-- Debounced trigger to prevent rapid clicks -->
    <v-btn 
      :disabled="isProcessing"
      @click.once="openSearchModal"
      class="search-mobile__trigger"
    >
      <v-icon>{{ icons.mdiMagnify }}</v-icon>
    </v-btn>
    
    <!-- Modal with proper cleanup -->
    <v-dialog 
      v-model="showModal" 
      :persistent="isSearching"
      @input="handleModalStateChange"
    >
      <!-- Content with error boundaries -->
    </v-dialog>
  </div>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      isProcessing: false,
      searchTimeout: null
    };
  },
  
  methods: {
    async openSearchModal() {
      // Prevent double-clicks
      if (this.isProcessing) return;
      this.isProcessing = true;
      
      try {
        this.showModal = true;
      } finally {
        // Reset after animation completes
        setTimeout(() => { this.isProcessing = false; }, 300);
      }
    }
  },
  
  beforeDestroy() {
    // Cleanup to prevent memory leaks
    if (this.searchTimeout) {
      clearTimeout(this.searchTimeout);
    }
  }
};
</script>
```

Now I need to create the global mobile search component that can determine the current page context:

---

```diff
- 
+ <template>
+   <div>
+     <!-- Global Mobile Search Modal -->
+     <search-mobile 
+       v-if="currentSearchMode"
+       :mode="currentSearchMode"
+       @search-loading="handleSearchLoading"
+       @search-results-loaded="handleSearchResults"
+     />
+   </div>
+ </template>
+ 
+ <script>
+ import SearchMobile from './search-mobile.vue';
+ 
+ export default {
+   name: 'search-mobile-global',
+   components: {
+     SearchMobile
+   },
+   
+   computed: {
+     currentSearchMode() {
+       // Determine search mode based on current route
+       const routeName = this.$route.name;
+       
+       if (routeName === 'calendarPage' || routeName === 'eventPage') return 'events';
+       if (routeName === 'allAthletesPage' || routeName === 'athletePage') return 'athletes';
+       if (routeName === 'juryPage' || routeName === 'juryPage') return 'jury';
+       if (routeName === 'trainersPage' || routeName === 'trainerPage') return 'trainers';
+       if (routeName === 'organizationsPage' || routeName === 'organizationPage') return 'organizations';
+       if (routeName === 'seminarsPage' || routeName === 'seminarPage') return 'seminars';
+       
+       return null; // No search available on this page
+     }
+   },
+   
+   methods: {
+     handleSearchLoading(state) {
+       // Emit to current page component
+       this.$root.$emit('mobile-search-loading', state);
+     },
+     
+     handleSearchResults(results) {
+       // Emit to current page component
+       this.$root.$emit('mobile-search-results', results);
+     }
+   }
+ };
+ </script> 
```

+ 		config.plugin("prefetch").tap((options) => {
+ 			options[0].fileBlacklist = options[0].fileBlacklist || [];
+ 			options[0].fileBlacklist.push(/\.map$/, /hot-update\.js$/);
+ 			return options;
+ 		});
+ 	},
+ });

```diff

+ #!/usr/bin/env sh
+ . "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"
+ 
+ # Conventional Commits validation
+ commit_regex='^(feat|fix|docs|style|refactor|test|chore|perf|ci|build|revert)(\(.+\))?\!?:\s.{1,50}'
+ 
+ if ! grep -qE "$commit_regex" "$1"; then
+     echo "❌ Invalid commit message format!"
+     echo ""
+     echo "Commit message must follow Conventional Commits format:"
+     echo "  <type>[optional scope]: <description>"
+     echo ""
+     echo "Examples:"
+     echo "  feat: add mobile search component"
+     echo "  fix(auth): resolve JWT token validation"
+     echo "  docs: update API documentation"
+     echo "  style: fix ESLint formatting issues"
+     echo ""
+     echo "Valid types: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, chore, perf, ci, build, revert"
+     exit 1
+ fi
+ 
+ echo "✅ Commit message format is valid!"

Let's create a comprehensive CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions:

---

```diff
- 
+ name: CI/CD Pipeline
+ 
+ on:
+   push:
+     branches: [ main, develop ]
+   pull_request:
+     branches: [ main, develop ]
+ 
+ env:
+   NODE_VERSION: '18.x'
+   MONGODB_VERSION: '7.0'
+ 
+ jobs:
+   # Code Quality and Security
+   lint-and-security:
+     name: 🔍 Lint & Security Scan
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     
+     steps:
+     - name: Checkout code
+       uses: actions/checkout@v4
+       
+     - name: Setup Node.js
+       uses: actions/setup-node@v4
+       with:
+         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
+         cache: 'npm'
+         
+     - name: Install dependencies
+       run: |
+         npm ci
+         npm run install:all
+         
+     - name: Run ESLint
+       run: npm run lint:check
+       
+     - name: Security audit
+       run: npm audit --audit-level moderate
+       
+     - name: Run CodeQL Analysis
+       uses: github/codeql-action/init@v3
+       with:
+         languages: javascript
+         
+     - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
+       uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v3
+ 
+   # Frontend Tests
+   test-frontend:
+     name: 🎨 Frontend Tests
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     
+     steps:
+     - name: Checkout code
+       uses: actions/checkout@v4
+       
+     - name: Setup Node.js
+       uses: actions/setup-node@v4
+       with:
+         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
+         cache: 'npm'
+         
+     - name: Install dependencies
+       run: |
+         npm ci
+         npm run install:frontend
+         
+     - name: Run frontend tests
+       run: |
+         cd frontend
+         npm run test:coverage
+         
+     - name: Upload frontend coverage
+       uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
+       with:
+         files: ./frontend/coverage/lcov.info
+         flags: frontend
+         name: frontend-coverage
+ 
+   # Backend Tests
+   test-backend:
+     name: 🔧 Backend Tests
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     
+     services:
+       mongodb:
+         image: mongo:7.0
+         env:
+           MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME: testuser
+           MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD: testpass
+         ports:
+           - 27017:27017
+           
+       redis:
+         image: redis:7-alpine
+         ports:
+           - 6379:6379
+           
+     steps:
+     - name: Checkout code
+       uses: actions/checkout@v4
+       
+     - name: Setup Node.js
+       uses: actions/setup-node@v4
+       with:
+         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
+         cache: 'npm'
+         
+     - name: Install dependencies
+       run: |
+         npm ci
+         npm run install:backend
+         
+     - name: Run backend tests
+       run: |
+         cd backend
+         npm run test:coverage
+       env:
+         NODE_ENV: test
+         DB_USER: testuser
+         DB_PWD: testpass
+         DB_HOSTNAME: localhost
+         DB_PORT: 27017
+         DB: test_ffr_live
+         JWT_SECRET: test_secret_key_for_testing_only
+         
+     - name: Upload backend coverage
+       uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
+       with:
+         files: ./backend/coverage/lcov.info
+         flags: backend
+         name: backend-coverage
+ 
+   # Build and Docker
+   build-and-docker:
+     name: 🐳 Build & Docker
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     needs: [lint-and-security, test-frontend, test-backend]
+     
+     steps:
+     - name: Checkout code
+       uses: actions/checkout@v4
+       
+     - name: Setup Node.js
+       uses: actions/setup-node@v4
+       with:
+         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
+         cache: 'npm'
+         
+     - name: Install dependencies
+       run: |
+         npm ci
+         npm run install:all
+         
+     - name: Build frontend
+       run: npm run build:frontend
+       
+     - name: Set up Docker Buildx
+       uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
+       
+     - name: Login to Docker Hub
+       if: github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
+       uses: docker/login-action@v3
+       with:
+         username: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
+         password: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}
+         
+     - name: Build and push Docker images
+       if: github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
+       run: |
+         docker buildx build --platform linux/amd64,linux/arm64 \
+           -t ffr-live/backend:latest \
+           -t ffr-live/backend:${{ github.sha }} \
+           --push ./backend
+           
+         docker buildx build --platform linux/amd64,linux/arm64 \
+           -t ffr-live/frontend:latest \
+           -t ffr-live/frontend:${{ github.sha }} \
+           --push ./frontend
+           
+     - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
+       uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
+       with:
+         image-ref: 'ffr-live/backend:latest'
+         format: 'sarif'
+         output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
+         
+     - name: Upload Trivy scan results
+       uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v3
+       if: always()
+       with:
+         sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'
+ 
+   # Integration Tests
+   integration-tests:
+     name: 🧪 Integration Tests
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     needs: [build-and-docker]
+     
+     steps:
+     - name: Checkout code
+       uses: actions/checkout@v4
+       
+     - name: Start services
+       run: |
+         cp .env.example .env
+         docker-compose up -d
+

+       run: |

+     - name: Run integration tests
+       run: |
+         cd backend
+         npm run test:integration
+         
+     - name: Cleanup
+       if: always()
+       run: docker-compose down -v
+ 
+   # Performance Tests
+   performance-tests:
+     name: ⚡ Performance Tests
+     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+     needs: [integration-tests]
+     if: github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
+     
+     steps:
+     - name: Checkout code
+       uses: actions/checkout@v4
+       
+     - name: Setup Node.js
+       uses: actions/setup-node@v4
+       with:
+         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
+         
+     - name: Install Artillery
+       run: npm install -g artillery@latest
+       
+     - name: Start services
+       run: |
+         cp .env.example .env
+         docker-compose up -d
+         
+     - name: Wait for services
+       run: |

+         
+     - name: Run performance tests
+       run: |

+         artillery report report.json --output performance-report.html
+         
+     - name: Upload performance report
+       uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
+       with:
+         name: performance-report
+         path: performance-report.html
+ 
+   # Deployment

+     - name: Deploy to production

+       if: always()

+ # 🚀 FFR Live Platform - Developer Setup Guide
+ 
+ ## 📋 Prerequisites
+ 
+ ### Required Software Versions
+ - **Node.js**: >= 18.12.0 (LTS recommended)
+ - **npm**: >= 8.0.0 (comes with Node.js)
+ - **Docker**: >= 20.10.0
+ - **Docker Compose**: >= 2.0.0
+ - **Git**: >= 2.30.0
+ 
+ ### Recommended Tools
+ - **VS Code** with extensions:
+   - ESLint
+   - Vue Language Features (Volar)
+   - Docker
+   - GitLens
+ - **MongoDB Compass** (for database management)
+ - **Postman** or **Insomnia** (for API testing)
+ 
+ ## 🔧 Quick Start (Recommended)
+ 
+ ### Option 1: Docker Development Environment (Easiest)
+ 
+ 1. **Clone the repository**
+    ```bash
+    git clone <repository-url>
+    cd ffr_live_web_app
+    ```
+ 
+ 2. **Create environment file**
+    ```bash
+    cp env.example .env
+    # Edit .env with your preferred settings
+    ```
+ 
+ 3. **Start the development environment**
+    ```bash
+    npm run dev:full
+    ```
+ 
+ 4. **Access the application**
+    - Frontend: http://localhost:8080
+    - Backend API: http://localhost:8081
+    - MongoDB Express: http://localhost:8082 (admin/pass)
+    - Redis Commander: http://localhost:8083
+ 
+ ### Option 2: Mixed Development (Frontend local, Backend in Docker)
+ 
+ 1. **Follow steps 1-2 from Option 1**
+ 
+ 2. **Start backend services only**
+    ```bash
+    npm run dev:db
+    npm run dev:backend
+    ```
+ 
+ 3. **Install and run frontend locally**
+    ```bash
+    npm run install:frontend
+    npm run dev:frontend
+    ```
+ 
+ ## 🛠️ Fixing Node.js Version Issues
+ 
+ If you encountered the error about Node.js version incompatibility:
+ 
+ ### Windows (Using nvm-windows)
+ 
+ 1. **Install nvm-windows**
+    - Download from: https://github.com/coreybutler/nvm-windows/releases
+    - Install and restart your terminal
+ 
+ 2. **Install and use Node.js 18**
+    ```powershell
+    nvm install 18.19.0
+    nvm use 18.19.0
+    node --version  # Should show v18.19.0
+    ```
+ 
+ ### macOS/Linux (Using nvm)
+ 
+ 1. **Install nvm**
+    ```bash
+    curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash
+    source ~/.bashrc
+    ```
+ 
+ 2. **Install and use Node.js 18**
+    ```bash
+    nvm install 18.19.0
+    nvm use 18.19.0
+    nvm alias default 18.19.0
+    node --version  # Should show v18.19.0
+    ```
+ 
+ ### Using Official Node.js Installer
+ 
+ 1. **Download Node.js 18.x LTS** from https://nodejs.org/
+ 2. **Uninstall old version** and install new version
+ 3. **Verify installation**
+    ```bash
+    node --version  # Should show v18.x.x
+    npm --version   # Should show >= 8.x.x
+    ```
+ 
+ ## 📦 Manual Installation Steps
+ 
+ If you prefer to set up everything manually:
+ 
+ ### 1. Environment Setup
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Copy environment template
+ cp env.example .env
+ 
+ # Install root dependencies
+ npm install
+ 
+ # Install all project dependencies
+ npm run install:all
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 2. Database Setup
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Start MongoDB with Docker
+ npm run dev:db
+ 
+ # Or install MongoDB locally and ensure it's running on port 27017
+ ```
+ 
+ ### 3. Development Servers
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Terminal 1: Backend
+ cd backend
+ npm run dev
+ 
+ # Terminal 2: Frontend  
+ cd frontend
+ npm run serve
+ 
+ # Or use the unified command
+ npm run dev
+ ```
+ 
+ ## 🧹 Cleaning Up Issues
+ 
+ ### Remove Yarn Dependencies
+ 
+ If you have yarn.lock files (we standardized on npm):
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Remove yarn lock files
+ find . -name "yarn.lock" -delete
+ 
+ # Clean node_modules
+ npm run clean
+ 
+ # Fresh install
+ npm run install:all
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Fix Common Issues
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Clear npm cache
+ npm cache clean --force
+ 
+ # Remove node_modules and reinstall
+ npm run clean
+ npm run install:all
+ 
+ # Rebuild native dependencies
+ npm rebuild
+ ```
+ 
+ ## 🔍 Development Workflow
+ 
+ ### Code Quality Checks
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Lint all code
+ npm run lint
+ 
+ # Fix linting issues
+ npm run format
+ 
+ # Run tests
+ npm run test
+ 
+ # Check security vulnerabilities
+ npm run security:audit
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Git Workflow
+ 
+ We use **Conventional Commits** with automated hooks:
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Good commit messages
+ git commit -m "feat: add mobile search component"
+ git commit -m "fix(auth): resolve JWT token validation"
+ git commit -m "docs: update setup instructions"
+ 
+ # Hooks will automatically:
+ # - Run ESLint and fix issues
+ # - Validate commit message format
+ # - Run security audit
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Docker Commands
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Build containers
+ npm run docker:build
+ 
+ # Start all services
+ npm run docker:up
+ 
+ # Stop all services
+ npm run docker:down
+ 
+ # View logs
+ npm run docker:logs
+ 
+ # Clean everything
+ npm run clean:docker
+ ```
+ 
+ ## 🚨 Troubleshooting
+ 
+ ### Port Conflicts
+ 
+ If ports are already in use:
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Check what's using a port (Windows)
+ netstat -ano | findstr :8080
+ 
+ # Kill process by PID
+ taskkill /PID <PID> /F
+ 
+ # Check what's using a port (macOS/Linux)
+ lsof -i :8080
+ 
+ # Kill process
+ kill -9 <PID>
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Permission Issues (Docker)
+ 
+ ```bash
+ # Fix Docker permission issues (Linux/macOS)
+ sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
+ newgrp docker
+ 
+ # Reset Docker Desktop (Windows)
+ # Right-click Docker Desktop -> Restart
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Database Connection Issues
+ 
+ 1. **Check MongoDB is running**
+    ```bash
+    docker ps | grep mongo
+    ```
+ 
+ 2. **Check connection string in .env**
+    ```bash
+    # Verify these match your setup:
+    DB_USER=admin
+    DB_PWD=strongpassword123
+    DB_HOSTNAME=localhost
+    DB_PORT=27017
+    ```
+ 
+ 3. **Test connection**
+    ```bash
+    # Using MongoDB Compass
+    mongodb://admin:strongpassword123@localhost:27017/ffr_live_dev?authSource=admin
+    ```
+ 
+ ## 🎯 Development Tools Setup
+ 
+ ### VS Code Configuration
+ 
+ Create `.vscode/settings.json`:
+ 
+ ```json
+ {
+   "eslint.workingDirectories": ["frontend", "backend"],
+   "editor.codeActionsOnSave": {
+     "source.fixAll.eslint": true
+   },
+   "editor.formatOnSave": false,
+   "files.eol": "\n",
+   "editor.defaultFormatter": "dbaeumer.vscode-eslint"
+ }
+ ```
+ 
+ ### Environment Variables for IDEs
+ 
+ For debugging in VS Code, create `.vscode/launch.json`:
+ 
+ ```json
+ {
+   "version": "0.2.0",
+   "configurations": [
+     {
+       "name": "Launch Backend",
+       "type": "node",
+       "request": "launch",
+       "program": "${workspaceFolder}/backend/server.js",
+       "env": {
+         "NODE_ENV": "development"
+       },
+       "envFile": "${workspaceFolder}/.env"
+     }
+   ]
+ }
+ ```
+ 
+ ## 📚 Additional Resources
+ 
+ - [Vue.js 2 Documentation](https://v2.vuejs.org/)
+ - [Vuetify 2 Documentation](https://v2.vuetifyjs.com/)
+ - [Express.js Documentation](https://expressjs.com/)
+ - [MongoDB Documentation](https://docs.mongodb.com/)
+ - [Docker Documentation](https://docs.docker.com/)
+ 
+ ## 🆘 Getting Help
+ 
+ 1. **Check the logs**
+    ```bash
+    npm run docker:logs
+    ```
+ 
+ 2. **Join our development chat**
+    - Slack: #ffr-live-dev
+    - Discord: FFR Live Development
+ 
+ 3. **Create an issue**
+    - Use our issue templates
+    - Include error logs and environment details
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ **Happy coding! 🚀** 
```

+ # Multi-stage Dockerfile for FFR Live Backend
+ FROM node:18-alpine AS base
+ 
+ # Set working directory
+ WORKDIR /app
+ 
+ # Create non-root user for security
+ RUN addgroup -g 1001 -S nodejs && \
+     adduser -S backend -u 1001
+ 
+ # Install dependencies stage
+ FROM base AS dependencies
+ 
+ # Copy package files
  COPY package*.json ./
  
- RUN npm install --production
- 
+ # Install all dependencies (including dev dependencies)
+ RUN npm ci --include=dev
+ 
+ # Development stage
+ FROM base AS development
+ 
+ # Copy dependencies
+ COPY --from=dependencies /app/node_modules ./node_modules
+ 
+ # Copy source code
+ COPY . .
+ 
+ # Change ownership to non-root user
+ RUN chown -R backend:nodejs /app
+ USER backend
+ 
+ # Expose port and debug port
+ EXPOSE 8080 9229
+ 
+ # Start development server with hot reload
+ CMD ["npm", "run", "dev"]
+ 
+ # Production build stage
+ FROM base AS build
+ 
+ # Copy dependencies
+ COPY --from=dependencies /app/node_modules ./node_modules
+ 
+ # Copy source code
  COPY . .
  
- FROM node:alpine
- 
- WORKDIR /home/ffr_live_back
- 
- COPY --from=build-stage /home/ffr_live_back /home/ffr_live_back
- 
- RUN mkdir -p /home/ffr_live_back/uploads
- 
- EXPOSE 8080 443
- 
- CMD [ "npm", "run", "start:prod" ]
+ # Remove dev dependencies and build (if needed)
+ RUN npm prune --production
+ 
+ # Production stage
+ FROM base AS production
+ 
+ # Copy production dependencies and built application
+ COPY --from=build /app/node_modules ./node_modules
+ COPY --from=build /app .
+ 
+ # Create necessary directories
+ RUN mkdir -p /app/uploads /app/logs && \
+     chown -R backend:nodejs /app
+ 
+ # Change to non-root user
+ USER backend
+ 
+ # Expose port
+ EXPOSE 8080
+ 
+ # Health check
+ HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=3s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \
+     CMD node -e "require('http').get('http://localhost:8080/api/v1/health', (res) => process.exit(res.statusCode === 200 ? 0 : 1))"
+ 
+ # Start production server
+ CMD ["npm", "run", "start"]

## 🔍 **QA Agent**: Still Conflicting Dependencies!

Now we have a **new conflict**! The issue is that:

- `@vue/cli-plugin-unit-jest@5.0.8` wants `@vue/vue2-jest@^27.0.0-alpha.3`
- But we're trying to use `@vue/vue2-jest@^29.2.6`

This suggests the **Vue CLI plugin is outdated**!

## ⚙️ **Backend Agent**: Plugin Version Mismatch

The `@vue/cli-plugin-unit-jest@5.0.8` is incompatible with the newer `@vue/vue2-jest@29.x`. We need to either:

1. **Use --legacy-peer-deps** (quick fix)
2. **Update Vue CLI plugin** to support newer jest versions
3. **Remove Vue CLI Jest plugin** and configure Jest manually

**Frontend Agent**, what's your recommendation? Time is critical here!

The problem is that **Vuetify components themselves** are trying to import `./colors.css`, `./sizes.css`, and `./styling.css` **from INSIDE the node_modules/vuetify directory**, but those files don't exist there!

## ⚙️ **Backend Agent**: This is a Build System Configuration Error!

The auto-injection in `vue.config.js` is **not working as intended**. When we import `@import "@/assets/styles/variables/_index.scss";` globally, it affects **ALL SASS files**, including Vuetify's own components!

**Frontend Agent**, we need to **IMMEDIATELY remove the auto-injection** or change our approach!

## 🔍 **QA Agent**: The Root Cause Analysis

The issue is that when Vue auto-injects `@import "@/assets/styles/variables/_index.scss";` into every SASS file, it also injects it into **Vuetify's own SASS files** inside `node_modules`. 

Vuetify's SASS files then try to import `./colors.css` **relative to their own location** in `node_modules/vuetify/src/components/`, where those files don't exist!

+     'no-tabs': 'error',
      // Modern JS

Winston is a popular logging library for Node.js that provides:

However, for our current needs, we can create a simpler custom logger that will be sufficient. Here's a more straightforward approach:

```javascript:backend/utils/logger.js
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');

// Ensure logs directory exists
const logsDir = path.join(__dirname, '../logs');
if (!fs.existsSync(logsDir)) {
  fs.mkdirSync(logsDir);
}

// Simple timestamp function
const getTimestamp = () => new Date().toISOString();

// Format log message
const formatLog = (level, message, data = {}) => {
  const logEntry = {
    timestamp: getTimestamp(),
    level,
    message,
    ...data
  };
  return JSON.stringify(logEntry);
};

// Write to file
const writeToFile = (logEntry) => {
  const logFile = path.join(logsDir, `${process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development'}.log`);
  fs.appendFileSync(logFile, logEntry + '\n');
};

// Main logger object
const logger = {
  error: (message, data) => {
    const logEntry = formatLog('ERROR', message, data);
    console.error(logEntry);
    writeToFile(logEntry);
  },
  
  warn: (message, data) => {
    const logEntry = formatLog('WARN', message, data);
    console.warn(logEntry);
    writeToFile(logEntry);
  },
  
  info: (message, data) => {
    const logEntry = formatLog('INFO', message, data);
    console.info(logEntry);
    writeToFile(logEntry);
  },
  
  debug: (message, data) => {
    if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== 'production') {
      const logEntry = formatLog('DEBUG', message, data);
      console.debug(logEntry);
      writeToFile(logEntry);
    }
  }
};

module.exports = logger;
```

Now we can use this simpler logger throughout our application. Here's how to use it:

```javascript:backend/app.js

  });
  res.socket.on('error', (error) => {
    logger.error('Response socket error', { error: error.message });
  });
  next();
});
```

```javascript:backend/server.js

mongoose

This custom logger provides several benefits:
1. **Simple and Lightweight**: No external dependencies
2. **Structured Logging**: JSON format for easy parsing
3. **File and Console Output**: Logs are both displayed and saved
4. **Environment Awareness**: Debug logs only in development
5. **Timestamp Included**: Each log entry has a timestamp
6. **Data Support**: Can include additional data objects with logs

The logs will be stored in `backend/logs/` with separate files for different environments (development.log, production.log, etc.).

{"timestamp":"2024-03-20T10:15:31.456Z","level":"ERROR","message":"Request socket error","error":"Connection reset"}
```

This approach gives us all the essential logging functionality we need without the complexity of a full logging framework. We can always add more features to our custom logger as needed.
